issues.detailed_explaination: The 'strictNullChecks' option is set to false while 'strict' is set to true. This can lead to unexpected behavior as 'strict' enables a set of type-checking options, including 'strictNullChecks'.
issues.suggestion: Set 'strictNullChecks' to true to maintain consistency with the 'strict' option.
issues.severity_reason: Inconsistent configuration can lead to potential runtime errors.

issues.detailed_explaination: The 'noImplicitAny' option is set to false, which allows variables to have an implicit 'any' type. This can lead to type safety issues and makes the code less predictable.
issues.suggestion: Set 'noImplicitAny' to true to enforce explicit typing and improve type safety.
issues.severity_reason: Allowing implicit any can lead to bugs and makes the code harder to maintain.
